name: Lohith Munakala

More love to the kids, the volunteers at Belaku! üåª

name: Lishitha

name: Soujanya
experience: Honestly can't describe the experience in limited words. I would say it's my home amway from home. My most comfort and safe place. I am lucky enough to get this opportunity which helped me to grow personally and professionally. I would like to thank everyone out there‚ù§Ô∏è

I‚Äôm really grateful to be a part of the Impact movement it‚Äôs been an amazing journey.‚ú®

name: Sahana
experience: Well, I came for a day and stayed for a while year and counting. It changed me and brought back a sense of purpose for me. And of course, the kids make me feel like a movie star every-time I walk into the centre! I get to give and receive so much love that it really changed me ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Sath
experience: It is the most rewarding feeling that I have experienced. Every moment spent with every child humbles me and droves me to change their lives a little, one day at a time.

name: Yashwanth
experience: At U&I, it wasn‚Äôt just about teaching, it was about building trust, sharing smiles, and growing together. What started as a simple weekend commitment became something I looked forward to every week. I learned just as much from the children as they did from me. It reminded me that even small efforts can lead to meaningful change.

name: Shreya Ramesh
experience: Volunteering at U&I was a heartwarming experience. I loved connecting with the kids, helping them learn, and watching them grow more confident each day. It taught me patience, empathy, and the joy of giving back. I‚Äôm grateful for the memories and the chance to make a small difference üå∏

name: Shyam
experience: Volunteering at U&I has been nothing short of life-changing. I still remember the first time I walked into the classroom nervous, unsure, but filled with hope. That one simple day turned into countless memories: the laughter during activities, the determination in the eyes of every student, and the overwhelming warmth of the U&I family. One moment that stands out is when a student, who had once been too shy to speak, confidently opened up and spoke feeling safe around me. U&I has become more than a place to volunteer; it‚Äôs become a place where hearts connect and lives transform.

name: Sanmathi Suresh
experience: An experience one has to have once in their lifetime. More than me being a teacher, kids have taught me the most simple lessons of life with their innocence and curiosity.  My fellow volunteers and my leaders had exceptional energy which pushed me to do better every week. Belaku has touched every life with light and energy. Blessed to be one amongst them.

name: Disha Rajgopal
experience: It was amazing experience...... Especially when I saw my kid...and also my co volunteers got to meet and work with such amazing people and yes the organisation it self is big thing ... And am truly grateful to be a part of this organisation .

name: Lahari
experience: It was something really special amid all my academic storm and boring life ....but looking  forward to this activity every Sunday was all worth it.Meeting the kid having fun while teaching ...is a whole new experience ‚ú®Ô∏è .. a break from all the worries I loved the whole of the time I spent here

name: Nandini
experience: I started off in August of 2024. Every moment,every hour taught, every event at the centre and every outing was super memorable. I learnt a lot too while teaching my kid and was super lucky to meet such amazing people!!!!.

name: Smriti
experience: It was a place I went to for one good reason, the cause. And within a few Sundays, I had a million reasons to continue and never one to just sleep in instead. And I love sleeping in.

name: Srushti S N
experience: Volunteering at Belaku has truly been a magical experience. Becoming part of such a warm and supportive community makes me feel so thankful for everything! This center introduced me to incredible people who share the same passion for making a difference, and together we've created memories I‚Äôll always cherish. Some of the special moments I had experienced during the journey were Children's day celebration we had with the kids and of course, the audio recording of our kids thanking us that was shared during EOY.The smiles on their face reminds me of the impact we're making. I'm so glad to have been part of this truly amazing community and I hope to make many more memories in the future!

name: Udayyyyy!
experience: U&I has been one of the most beautiful chapters of my life, Every part of it the kids, the leaders, the volunteers felt like a home I‚Äôll forever be grateful for Being a part of Belaku, it wasn‚Äôt just an experience it was a transformation. I walked in doubting myself, unsure if I could make a difference. But over time, I saw myself grow, and more importantly, I saw the spark in the kids‚Äô eyes which made me prove that something I did mattered to the kid. I still remember the moment that changed everything the kids running toward me with the full of joy, shouting, ‚ÄúAnna, what will you teach today?‚Äù That one moment held more magic than words could ever explain. It wasn‚Äôt just about teaching, it was about showing up, sharing love, and being a part of their world. Some of my most cherished memories come from our LC calls the laughter, the fun, the late night planning, and the random heartfelt conversations. It wasn‚Äôt just a team, it felt like family. This journey was nothing short of magical and it made me realize where my heart truly belong.

name: Maahi ‚ú®
experience: Heyyy! I‚Äôm Mahimaü´∂üèº and this is my U&I story. Back in December 2021, I wasn‚Äôt in a great place‚Äîdistanced from friends, skipping meals, and feeling lost. One day, my roommate convinced me to join a small get-together, where I met someone who told me about U&I. Something clicked that day‚ÄîI couldn‚Äôt stop crying. It felt like I had finally found purpose. ‚ù§ By May 2022, I got a call for an interview, and just like that, I felt like myself again. On August 20th, I had my first class‚Äîand that moment changed everything. Weekends became meaningful again, thanks to the warm smiles and energy of the incredible kids I got to meet. üíü There was a time I had to take a break due to health issues, but when I returned, the kids welcomed me back with so much joy‚Äîit truly made my heart full. The U&I community brought back light, connection, and a sense of belonging. In early 2023, I was asked to be a leader at Belaku, and I said yes despite my doubts. That decision turned out to be one of the best ones I‚Äôve made. Belaku has been my anchor. The kids there are some of the most beautiful souls I‚Äôve met‚Äîkind, loving, and so full of life. Each interaction was a shared learning experience, not just for them but for me too. Belaku helped me navigate one of the toughest years of my life. It gave me strength, purpose, and friendships that turned into family. Every weekend brought stories, laughter, and love‚Äîand seeing the kids run up to us with excitement was the highlight of it all. In 2024, I took a leap and became the Chapter Leader for Belaku. This role helped me grow immensely‚Äîteaching me leadership, patience, trust, and teamwork. U&I has been more than just volunteering‚Äîit's been a journey of healing, growth, and love. I‚Äôm forever grateful to be part of this incredible community. üíñüåà

name: Chai
experience: Each and every momet in Belaku was a memorable days for me where i had lot of connection with new people who treated me so good and helping me in different ways when i was not able to teach each and every people in belaku are so amazing ‚ù§Ô∏èü´∂üèª

name: Shalini B V S

He said , You always give me stars towards the end of the classes , today , I will give you a star , he's so adorable ü•πüò≠

name: Darpana

name: Divya

But it wasn‚Äôt just about academics it was about being part of a community filled with kindness, laughter, and genuine connections. The love and warmth I received made every moment unforgettable.

name: Hp :)
experience: Volunteering was a beautiful journey for me. I loved every bit of it. Every weekend felt special, but seeing the kids smile was always the highlight. name: Ruchitha
experience: U&I has been such an enlightening journey for me. In just a few months, the bond between the volunteers and kids grew into something truly special. With every meet, those connections only deepened.Belaku didn‚Äôt just create a space for learning but created a family turning moments into memories.

name: Vishaku
experience: Volunteering at belaku was life changing , I went from a girl who was so scared and didn't know how to talk to people to meeting the most amazing people who made me feel comfortable in my skin , and the kid I thought is I think U&I famous , he thought mentor smile and be happy at the smallest things and make the most out of life. My sweetest memory with Yesu was on EOY and for some reason he wasn't ready to listen at all and I had scold him and was kinda upset about it , and during the party he came upto me and gave me one of his chocolates and apologised , my heart was smiling

name: Shatakshi
experience: Everytime I'd walk into the Belaku, all my worries faded away as I was greeted by the cutest, happiest faces. These kids had so much joy and warmth in them that they made me feel happier just by their presence. I loved coming up with new ways to engage and teach them, and was constantly amazed at how bright and smart they were. All in all, this experience gave me the opportunity to make a small impact on the lives of these brilliant children, and I wouldn't trade that feeling for anything in the world :)

name: Gumms
experience: Great great experience :) The kids used to eagerly wait to meet us every week. A small contribution goes a long way! Also got to meet some amazing people who are close friends even to this day :)

name: Bhoomi
experience: Volunteering has brought out an another side of me . Never expected to meet such a nice community , students , fellow volunteers. The student I used to teach , he‚Äôs such a sweet guy . He learnt with me , played with me , vibed with me and him gaining confidence to deliver a speech in front of a class , that‚Äôs like the best memory . This fulfilment feeling is something we can‚Äôt explain , truly happy that I had this experience .

name: Neelima
experience: It was an amazing and fulfilling time! Initially, it took me a while to get used to it. But over time, it became a part of my routine, one that I looked forward to after a tiring week in college. Every day, coming up with new ways to connect with my kid and teaching him new things he looked forward to learning felt refreshing. One of my special memories is me coming up with special greetings where we both learnt how to say hello to each other in different languages and then use it to start off the day. Seeing him repeat words in a foreign language with better accuracy after each practice made me immensely happy as I felt like I was seeing him grow- slowly but surely towards his dream.

name: Sahana Jadav
experience: Some journeys don‚Äôt begin with a plan ‚Äî they begin with a feeling. Volunteering at U&I was one such spontaneous leap that led me to a place I didn‚Äôt know my heart needed. From the very first day at orientation, I was surrounded by warmth, laughter, and strangers who quickly became teammates, friends, and co-dreamers. Each teaching session wasn‚Äôt just about lessons and learning ‚Äî it was a weekly reminder of purpose. Seeing the spark in the children‚Äôs eyes, feeling the impact of even the smallest effort, brought me a sense of joy and peace I‚Äôd never experienced before. But what made U&I truly special were the moments in between ‚Äî the post-class debriefs where stories flowed freely, where we laughed, reflected, and grew together. And the events, oh, the events! From the magic of Christmas to the pure joy of Children‚Äôs Day, every celebration was a festival of love, color, and community. U&I wasn‚Äôt just an organization ‚Äî it was a mirror that reflected the change I wanted to see in the world and in myself. I walked in hoping to give, and left with my heart fuller than ever. Forever grateful for this chapter, and for every beautiful soul I met along the way.

name: Krushi
experience: One of the memorable experience I had while volunteering not only did i taught but I learnt so many things from kids, i am a very selective person when it comes to socializing but u&I is one such beautiful community where i love each and every friendship I made ,  my volunteering journey started in belaku and I can't be more happy and satisfied! name: Ruhi

Teaching Ajay was a total delight‚Äîhe‚Äôs an incredibly bright and curious learner who grasped new ideas in no time. Every session with him brought so much joy and positive energy to my weekends.
